message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I'm being asked to respond to a survey about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Lithuania. I need to indicate my level of agreement with each statement using one of the response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', or 'I don't know'.

Let me think about each statement from a teacher's perspective:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally true. Many teachers find AI useful for generating ideas and improving lesson plans. I'd say: Agree

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is also generally true. AI can help personalize content. I'd say: Agree

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - Yes, AI tools can help with personalized support. I'd say: Agree

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs) - AI can help with translation, reading support, etc. I'd say: Agree

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - Yes, this is a known benefit of AI. I'd say: Strongly agree

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a real concern with plagiarism and AI. As a teacher, I would acknowledge this is a risk. I'd say: Agree

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is a valid concern. AI can make mistakes. I'd say: Agree

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a legitimate concern about AI bias. I'd say: Agree

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - Data privacy is a major concern. I'd say: Agree


[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students - While AI could recommend questionable teaching methods, most educators would likely evaluate suggestions critically before implementing them. I'd say: Agree

Now I'll compile these responses and submit them.
